alert.note: Alert for Clarke; Jasper; Smith (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 24 at 9:53AM CDT until August 24 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: The National Weather Service in Jackson has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Smith County in central Mississippi... Clarke County in east central Mississippi... Jasper County in east central Mississippi... * Until 100 PM CDT. * At 953 AM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Quitman, Bay Springs, Raleigh, Stonewall, Paulding, Rose Hill, Garlandville, Turnerville, Orange, Barnett, Pineville, De Soto, Sable, Center Ridge, Burns, Middleton, Sykes, Crandall, Snell and White Oak. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR AND GAUGE INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
